ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Player wipe on Test
ygData.msgSnippet: I agree Steve.  I am angry that they wiped so fast and with so little notice.  I am not angry that they wiped.  Just that we got little to no warning.  I found
ygData.messageBody:
I agree Steve. I am angry that they wiped so fast and with so little
notice. I am not angry that they wiped. Just that we got little to no
warning. I found out this morning when I tried to log in to play on test
for a change. It's never been my primary server (ok it was while I was
powerlevelling myself to 50 there) so it's no big deal. But it was my only
50 char :( My character on Saryrn is only 44 as of now. It was nice to be
able to say I had a 50. Guess I just gotta work that much harder to get
another ;)

Am I going back? Hell no. I lost all my gear more times than I care to
remember to corpses getting stuck in walls, in geography in gates, whatever.
Then to get wiped with no notice because Verant f'd up? Nah, thanks I'll
stick to a live server. At least they back those up regularly.

Lyrnia
----- Original Message -----
From: "Stephen E. McCloskey" <s.mccloskey@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, June 21, 2000 10:17 AM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Player wipe on Test


> Well, I hate to sound like a hard ass but, it has always been said since
> day one that test is not a live server and be aware that your toon could
> always be wiped. Anyone playing on there agreed to that. People are
> supposed to be there to test the new patches, zones, items . . . what
ever.
> Not to "play" like people on the live servers do. Anyone on test should
> have seen that it would one day come down to a p-wipe.
>
>
> >In case some of you don't know, the entire player-base on the Test server
> >was wiped yesterday. Verant's reason being they wanted a clean slate to
> >conduct ongoing tests. Fair enough, I suppose - we wipe our test
database
> >from time to time to clear out all the junk that accumulates - but for
those
> >that had characters there, my condolences.
> >
> >I can only imagine what it must feel like to have built up a character
over
> >the last year to have it wiped, and with little or no warning from what
I've
> >heard.
>
>
>
